abstract: Action by the bank was viewed as a sign that the government is not eager to see an end to a rally that has more than doubled prices in the last 12 months.
snippet: Action by the bank was viewed as a sign that the government is not eager to see an end to a rally that has more than doubled prices in the last 12 months.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Acting a day after the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock markets plunged more than 7 percent, China’s central bank cut interest rates on Saturday and reduced the reserves that certain banks must hold.

headline.main: China Cuts Interest Rates After Market Plunge
headline.print_headline: China Cuts Interest Rates a Day After a Market Plunge
